pd.p: The rendering mode of the video. See .

p.props: ios mac cpp unity electron rn flutter

pd.p: The mirror mode of the view. See .

ul.li: For the mirror mode of the local video view: If you use a front camera, the SDK enables the mirror mode by default; if you use a rear camera, the SDK disables the mirror mode by default.
For the remote user: The mirror mode is disabled by default.

plentry.pd: The type of the video frame, see .
The ID of the video source.
Setting mode of the view. See .

Setting mode of the view.
(0): (Default) Replaces a view.
(1): Adds a view.
(2): Delete a view.
The ID of the media player. You can get the Device ID by calling .
This parameter is required when sourceType is .

(Android and iOS only) (Optional) The display area for the video frame. See . width and height represent the video pixel width and height of the area. The default value is null (width or height is 0), which means that the actual resolution of the video frame is displayed.

(Optional) The display area for video frames, which consists of the following parameters:
x: The horizontal offset from the top-left corner.
y: The vertical offset from the top-left corner.
width: The width of the region.
height: The height of the region. width and height represent the video pixel width and height of the area. The default value is null (width or height is 0), which means that the actual resolution of the video frame is displayed.
